bestBHT.bht: Begging Jesus' disciples to cast out the demon plaguing his child, the desperate father found their attempts futile. Despite their presence and best efforts, the disciples were unable to alleviate the suffering caused by the unclean spirit. This incident serves as a stark reminder of the insufficiency of human power and highlights the unparalleled authority of Jesus in overcoming darkness and spiritual affliction.

John Gill: And I besought thy disciples,.... The nine disciples that were left behind, whilst Christ, and the other three, were gone up to the mountain."
To cast him out; the devil out of his child."

bhtAttempts.bht: The desperate father in Luke 9:40 approached Jesus' disciples, pleading with them to cast out the demon tormenting his son. Unfortunately, their attempts were futile, and the demon remained. Despite their own experiences witnessing Jesus perform miracles, the disciples were unable to drive out the unclean spirit. This incident highlights the limitations of human effort and power and emphasizes the incomparable authority of Jesus in overcoming darkness and evil.

Approaching Jesus' disciples in desperation, a father pleaded for their help to cast out the demon afflicting his child. Disappointingly, their efforts came up short, making it evident that mere human intervention was insufficient. Even though they had witnessed Jesus performing miracles, the disciples were unable to rid the child of the tormenting spirit. This incident serves as a powerful reminder of the limitations of human strength and the unparalleled authority of Jesus in conquering darkness and spiritual evil.

Begging Jesus' disciples to cast out the demon plaguing his child, the desperate father found their attempts futile. Despite their presence and best efforts, the disciples were unable to alleviate the suffering caused by the unclean spirit. This incident serves as a stark reminder of the insufficiency of human power and highlights the unparalleled authority of Jesus in overcoming darkness and spiritual affliction.

Approaching the disciples with a plea, the agonized father sought their intervention in driving out the tormenting demon that afflicted his child. Regrettably, their efforts proved fruitless, exposing the inherent limitations of human capability. Even though they had witnessed Jesus perform countless miracles, the disciples found themselves unable to release the child from the grip of evil. This incident serves as a poignant demonstration of the surpassing authority and power that Jesus possesses, illuminating the inadequacy of human strength in combating spiritual darkness.

Making a desperate plea to the disciples, the distressed father implored them to cast out the demon afflicting his child. However, in spite of their efforts, they were unable to deliver the child from this tormenting spirit. This event highlights the limitations of human power and the significance of Jesus' unrivaled authority over spiritual forces. The disciples' inability to heal the child serves as a powerful reminder of the supreme authority and unmatched power that Jesus possesses to overcome darkness and deliverance from evil.
